text: - At Splunk, we help our customers build
resilient digital enterprise.
Very recently, we worked

on building a multi-region
resiliency service

for our customers who
have very specific needs

from compliance and regulation
perspective on their data.

It was a very high priority
challenge for us to solve
because a lot of our customers
who are in finance and healthcare markets,

they require Splunk
Cloud to have resiliency
that spans across multiple AWS Regions.

So we build this cross-region
disaster recovery solution
that's an active passive solution.
In an unlikely event,
if there's a disaster in an AWS Region,
our customers can continue using Splunk,
and we will just failover their stack
to a different region.
We use Amazon S3 Cross-Region Replication

and Replication Time
Control to build a solution.
Replication Time Control is important
because it guarantees specific SLAs,

which are important for
us to meet the commitments
that we have to the customers.

We also used multi-region
keys to get access
to the encrypted data on both regions.
Building on AWS allows us
to use some of the native services,
which simplifies our design.

It also helps us bring
these solutions faster
to the market and to our customers.
Now that we have this solution in place,
a lot of our customers

that are in highly
regulated industry benefits
from this solution.

Now they can accelerate
that digital transformation,

and they can onboard their
mission-critical use cases
to Splunk Cloud and really take advantage
of being in the public cloud.
(upbeat music fades)
